articles.title: Why Apple's Business Model Won't Work For Peloton And How The Fitness Company Can Turnaround Its Business
articles.content:
Beleaguered fitness platform Peloton Interactive, Inc. (NASDAQ: PTON), which had taken a leaf out of tech giant Apple, Inc.'s (NASDAQ: AAPL) business model, may need to rethink this strategy.
Peloton's Problem:  Apple has found much success with its approach of combining its hardware, software and services into one package, and Peloton was quick to adopt this approach, Bloomberg columnist Mark Gurman said.
Peloton  designs its own bikes and treadmills and has developed its own operating system that runs over Android, the writer noted. It also offers its own fitness content subscription service, he added.
The columnist noted that Peloton stumbled with this strategy, as it could not manage its supply chain. As the company moved ...

articles.title: Apple: Upgraded Price Target On Stronger Revenue Growth
articles.content: When we last covered Apple (AAPL) in Sept. 2021, we forecasted its revenue to grow by 26.9% for FY2021. See why we have upgraded our price target for AAPL now.
